text:
Hello, everyone,
I'm trying to engage a note to a contact in my public app but I receive this response:
```{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "This app hasn't been granted all required scopes to make this call. Read more about required scopes here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>.",
  "correlationId": "a195a8e0-368e-48f8-92b7-302f9b90c488",
  "errors": [
    {
      "message": "One or more of the following scopes are required.",
      "context": {
        "requiredScopes": [
          "e-commerce",
          "tickets",
          "crm.objects.goals.read",
          "media_bridge.read",
          "crm.objects.custom.read",
          "crm.objects.custom.write"
        ],
        "requiredGranularScopes": [
          "crm.objects.contacts.write",
          "crm.objects.line_items.read",
          "crm.objects.line_items.write",
          "crm.objects.quotes.write",
          "crm.objects.quotes.read",
          "crm.objects.contacts.read",
          "crm.objects.companies.read",
          "crm.objects.deals.read",
          "crm.objects.deals.write",
          "crm.objects.companies.write"
        ]
      }
    }
  ],
  "links": {
    "scopes": "<https://developers.HubSpot.com/scopes>"
  },
  "category": "MISSING_SCOPES"
}```
Do I need a paid account because these scopes are added to my app?

Hello everyone!! :wave:

We have two questions related to the threadId property:
• We need to retrieve the associated list of treadId’s from a ticket by ticket ID.
• We need to create a threadId by sending an email through the API (doing a POST to /crm/v3/objects/emails) like when you reply to an email from the HS interface, which creates one. The conversations API does not have the option to create one but only modify or get an existing one.
Could you give us guidance on how to achieve this, as we’re not finding a clear information in the documentation? Thank you!
FYI: <@U0513B5HKEU> <@U050DLF1YMQ> <@U049WTE7AEB>
<@U01QVR44MEY> Can you help us with this please?
Are you doing three different custom code actions back to back to back?
of course
1. You can use the associations endpoint to pull these associations: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/ticket/{ticketId}/associations/conversation>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>

2. Currently you can create an email through the api no problem but this email is basically just an informal placeholder. It's not tied to any (ticket, conversation etc). For conversations though this isn't as simple, the only way for conversations to get created is for emails to be sent to HubSpot. So you would have to programmatically send an email with all the conversation info to create that conversation. You could do this with the single send api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails>
no benefits whatsoever
unless you are building an app that you want to use across multiple portals and not have your uses create private apps tokens for you
you don't need a paid account to do this, you just need to correct scopes on your app. Which scopes do you have?
All of them that are in the response
Thanks. Our team will check your suggestions and come back if needed
and did you generate a new token?
ok
Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY>!
yes, I uninstalled the app from the test account and installed with the new URL
of course

I'm using the dev API key
`$client = Factory::createWithDeveloperApiKey($dev_api_key);`
as your token?
I'm using the php SDK
Yeah so that dev hapikey isn't meant to be used with any of those calls
instead of a oauth access token or private app access token I'm using the dev api key (API Key)
dev hapikeys are only able to make certain api calls like timeline event templates they can't make normal api calls
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/oauth-quickstart-guide>
You need to install the app on your account, then use the code that HubSpot sends back to get a refresh token
then use that refresh token in the api call

I've already tried with the access token and the request works fine except that the note is not engaged with the contact.
With a private app access token, everything works as you expect it.
But I'm using the CRM extension so the private app is not an option
do you have the request response from the time you tried with a refresh token?
run your request through Postman to make sure it has all the neccesary scopes
no, I didn't try to refresh a token because the first token wasn't expired
That's not what I said
just a moment
Do you mean how to increment and get the next deal in sequential order?

```HubSpot\Client\Crm\Objects\Notes\Model\SimplePublicObject Object
(
    [container:protected] => Array
        (
            [id] => 16666494949
            [properties] => Array
                (

<@U01QVR44MEY>
Yes!! Do you have a hint of how to do this?

Hi Team!
We want to integrate GoTo (cloud telephony where phone calls are stored on the PBX platform itself) with HubSpot through API development and we would like to know whether after this integration, whether phone calls will continue to be stored in HubSpot or will remain by default on the GoTo platform?
if you use the notes api to pull that note using the id in the above response what do you see? because it looks like it's getting created
but possibly not getting associated to the contact
Yes, the note is created but not associated with the contact
You can log the calls in HubSpot using the calls endpoint: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/calls>
You can also use this endpoint to transcribe the calls: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/recordings-and-transcriptions>
perfect Carter. Thanks a lot for your informations. You have a good day!
of course you as well
I would personally use the list api and paging to find them <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals> . I think that would get you what you need

Hi all! HubSpot Product Manager of the Conversations APIs here (I have keyword notifications enabled :slightly_smiling_face: ) . <@U05072J3HPG> and team, I'd love to learn more about the 'why' /  problem you are trying to solve in asking these questions, and in determining if the workarounds Carter proposed would provide a good experience for your end customers. Would you be open to a short interview? And <@U01QVR44MEY> you're such an active contributor here with seemingly wide knowledge about all the HubSpot APIs, would you be willing for me to interview you at some point about trends you see with developers wanting to extend messaging/communication solutions in HubSpot?
Hey <@U04B32JHTUZ>, good to finally meet you, been meaning to reach out since you first came to work with HubSpot. I'm always available just ping me.

Hi there,

I am trying to update a timeline event from an external system. Ideally I'd like to use the HubSpot developer API key, but it looks like access was revoked. However, the documentation is a bit misleading. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/timeline>

It looks like you can define timeline templates using the api key, but then in order to create a timeline even on a contact, you need to provide oauth. Is that correct? How would I go about to get my oauth token If I am updating the contact from an external service that allows me to send webhooks? Do I need to first call my server to get the oauth token/refresh it and then call the HubSpot API?

Hey guys! How are you?
I want to know if HubSpot receives a list of contacts and if the contact checks if this contact already exists or not and if it doesn't exist, it can be created without the need for a new request.

If you are using this in a workflow, is there a chance that multiple workflows run at the same time?
Also the search endpoints have a lower rate limit than all the other calls.
this should be the only high volume workflow
I meant if there are multiple instances of this workflow running. Does this error happen if you manually enroll only one contact/deal/company/xyz?
no it does not occur with a single contact
there is a separate issue that it's far to zealous in merging users and has merged 50 people by first name ahaha

you might be better off writing a small script outside of HubSpot.
if you have any property value that guarantees that two (or more contacts) are infact the same, the task is fairly easy to implement.
First you search for all contacts and only add the property that helps with the matching.
Then you group the responses by said values in a map.

Last step is to use v1 merge-contacts for all of those where you found more than one contact with the same property value.

Inside of a workflow you will run into a few issues, but maybe someone else in the community has come up with a nice workaround.
For the import api if you specify the email address as a unique field HubSpot will update instead of create
And if not exists, will be created?
Correct
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/imports#endpoint?spec=POST-/crm/v3/imports/>
Thank you.
of course
Yeah so you use the developer key to update/create the templates (because these are the same on every portal the app is installed on)
then use use an oauth token to create a specific event (you use oauth because it's specific to a portal)
Most people have oauth setup on the same server/endpoint that they receive webhooks from, so you could also set it up that way if you wanted, definitely not required though

Ah right, this makes sense. So what you say is that since the template creation is common to all the portals you can use the dev api key, but if you want to modify a specific portal you need to provide relevant auth for that specific portal, hence you need oauth
Thanks
yep exactly

Hey everyone!

We had to learn a lot about how HubSpot’s API works in order to build our sync on top of it. HubSpot’s API poses some unique challenges for syncing/change data capture: limited webhook support, limited support for querying associations, mixed support for detecting deletes, and an eventually consistent search API.

We discuss things like:
• schema introspection
• using the search API for change detection
• when eventual consistency happens and how to deal with it
• how to sync associations
We decided to write our whole playbook up in case it would help others building on top of the HubSpot API. If you’re building a sync or change data capture pipeline on top of HubSpot’s API, I hope you find it useful :pray:

If we missed anything or you have other ideas on how to accomplish the same task, let me know.

<https://blog.sequin.io/building-a-sync-on-HubSpots-api/>
Learning that the search API was eventually consistent was really surprising for us. Curious if anyone else has run up on this issue?

Hello everyone. Is there a place where I can get all the "methods" under HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi ? (getPage, getById, create)

I am using a HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi.doSearch but really I wanted to getByEmail (if there's one) and I would like to get properties (I can do this currently) AND ASSOCIATIONS (I can't manage to get the companies associated to this contact).

It's my first time trying the API and a code on a workflow, so a bit lost here. Thanks in advance!
Using Node by the way
Yeah so instead of the search endpoint you'll want to use the normal contacts endpoint and use the contact email address instead of the contact id:
If you use the email instead of the id you'll want to use the idProperty parameter and set it to email
Hey, thanks for the reply. I'm working on something else right now but I will take a look later. Thanks!

We use `hs_email_direction` to determine whether an email is incoming or not. According to the docs Incoming emails have the value of `INCOMING_EMAIL`. However, we’re seeing some incoming emails to HubSpot users being marked with the value of `EMAIL`. Has anybody else seen this before?
sounds good
